intro: Chilenia nigrihorrida var. minor, commonly known as the small black-hairy chilenia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its dark, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it faces threats to its survival in the wild.
